definition:
Given a group $G$, the [*regular representation*]{} of $G$ over a field
$K$ is the representation
$\rho: G \longrightarrow {\operatorname{GL}}(K^G)$ whose underlying
vector space $K^G$ is the $K$–vector space of formal linear combinations
of elements of $G$, defined by
$$\rho(g)\left(\sum_{i=1}^n k_i g_i\right) := \sum_{i=1}^n k_i (g g_i)$$
for $k_i \in K$, $g, g_i \in G$.

Equivalently, the regular representation is the induced representation
on $G$ of the trivial representation on the subgroup $\{1\}$ of $G$.
